org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as

Class NodeBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.NodeBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IASNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FixedChildrenNode, InstructionListNode, MXMLNodeBase, TreeNode

    public abstract class NodeBase
extends SourceLocation
implements IASNode
    Base class for ActionScript parse tree nodes

    • Field Detail

      • emptyNodeArray

        protected static final IASNode[] emptyNodeArray
        Used in calls to CheapArray functions. It represents the type of objects that appear in fSymbols.

      • parent

        protected IASNode parent
        Parent node.

        Methods (even in NodeBase itself) should use getParent() instead of accessing this member directly. getParent() is overridden in FileNode to do something special when the FileNode represents a shared file.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: IASNode

        Specified by:
        contains in interface IASNode
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to test
        Returns:
        true if the offset is contained within this node

      • looselyContains

        public boolean looselyContains(int offset)
        Determine whether the offset "loosely" fits within this node. With normal nodes, this will return true if the offset matches fLocation.fStart or fLocation.fEnd or anything in between. With bogus nodes (which have fStart == fEnd), this will return true if the offset comes after fStart and before any other nodes in the parse tree
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to test
        Returns:
        true if the offset is "loosely" contained within this node

      • getSucceedingNode

        public IASNode getSucceedingNode(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: IASNode
        Get the first node that succeeds the offset (i.e. which starts after the offset).
        Specified by:
        getSucceedingNode in interface IASNode
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset for which to search
        Returns:
        the most general node that starts after the offset (or null, if the offset isn't contained within this node)

      • isTransparent

        public boolean isTransparent()
        Determine whether this node is transparent. If a node is transparent, it can never be returned from getContainingNode... the offset will be considered part of the parent node instead.
        Returns:
        true if the node is transparent

      • swapChildren

        protected void swapChildren(NodeBase child,
                NodeBase target)
        Changes the position of two children in our tree. Neither child can be null and both must have the same parent
        Parameters:
        child - the child to replace target
        target - the child to replace child

      • replaceChild

        protected void replaceChild(NodeBase child,
                NodeBase target)
        Replaces the child with the given target. The child will be removed from the tree, and its parentage will be updated
        Parameters:
        child - the NodeBase to replace
        target - the NodeBase to replace the replaced

      • normalize

        public void normalize(boolean fillInOffsets)
        Normalize the tree. Move custom children into the real child list and fill in missing offsets so that offset lookup will work. Used during parsing.

      • connectedToProjectScope

        protected void connectedToProjectScope()
        Allow various subclasses to do special kludgy things like identify mx.core.Application.application

      • setChildren

        protected void setChildren(boolean fillInOffsets)
        If this node has custom children (names, arguments, etc), shove them into the list of children. Used during parsing.

      • fillInOffsets

        protected void fillInOffsets()
        If the start and end offsets haven't been set explicitly, fill them in based on the offsets of the children. Used during parsing. If the end offset is less than any of the kids' offsets, change fLocation.fEnd to encompass kids.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(NodeBase parent)
        Set the parent node. Used during parsing.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent node

      • getScopeNode

        public IScopedNode getScopeNode()
        Get the nearest containing scope for this node. Used during type decoration.
        Returns:
        nearest containing scope for this node

      • getContainingFilePath

        public String getContainingFilePath()
        Get the path of the file in which this parse tree node resides.

        The tree builder can set a node's origin source file using SourceLocation.setSourcePath(String). If the source path was set, return the source path; Otherwise, use root FileNode's path.

        Returns:
        file path that contains this node

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        For debugging only. Displays this node and its children in a form like this: 
         FileNode "D:\tests\UIComponent.as" 0:0 0-467464  D:\tests\UIComponent.as
   PackageNode "mx.core" 12:1 436-465667 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
     FullNameNode "mx.core" 0:0 444-451 null
       IdentifierNode "mx" 12:9 444-446 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
       IdentifierNode "core" 12:12 447-451 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
     ScopedBlockNode 13:1 454-465667 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
       ImportNode "flash.accessibility.Accessibility" 14:1 457-497 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
       FullNameNode "flash.accessibility.Accessibility" 0:0 464-497 null
         FullNameNode "flash.accessibility" 0:0 464-483 null
           IdentifierNode "flash" 14:8 464-469 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
           IdentifierNode "accessibility" 14:14 470-483 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
         IdentifierNode "Accessibility" 14:28 484-497 D:\tests\UIComponent.as
       ...

        Subclasses may not override this, because we want to maintain regularity for how all nodes display.

        Overrides:
        toString in class SourceLocation

      • buildStringRecursive

        public void buildStringRecursive(StringBuilder sb,
                        int level,
                        boolean skipSrcPath)
        For debugging only. Called by toString(), and recursively by itself, to display this node on one line and each descendant node on subsequent indented lines. *

      • buildInnerString

        protected boolean buildInnerString(StringBuilder sb)
        For debugging only. This method is called by buildOuterString(). It is overridden by subclasses to display optional node-specific information in the middle of the string, between the node type and the location information.

      • getInnerString

        public String getInnerString()
        For debugging only.

      • collectImportNodes

        public void collectImportNodes(Collection<IImportNode> importNodes)
        Collects the import nodes that are descendants of this node but which are not contained within a scoped node.

        This is a helper method for IScopedNode.getAllImportNodes(java.util.Collection<org.apache.flex.compiler.tree.as.IImportNode>)(). Since that method walks up the chain of scoped nodes, we don't want to look inside scoped nodes that were already processed.

        Parameters:
        importNodes - The collection of import nodes being built.

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
        Used only in asserts.
